headline: What AES (AES)'s Panama Antitrust Lawsuit Could Mean For Shareholders
summary: In early January 2026, Panamanian firms Sinolam LNG Terminal and Sinolam Smarter Energy LNG Power filed a civil lawsuit in Virginia accusing AES and partners of a multi‑year scheme to block their LNG‑to‑power projects in Panama, seeking more than US$4.00 billion in damages. The complaint not only alleges coercive tactics and misuse of confidential information, but also claims AES leveraged government ties to secure effective monopoly control over Panama’s LNG import, storage, regasification,...

The complaint not only alleges coercive tactics and misuse of confidential information, but also claims AES leveraged government ties to secure effective monopoly control over Panama’s LNG import, storage, regasification,...
